Articles.Content: DeviantArt’s **[http://goo.gl/8z53TC](Y0rshee** came up with this image, showing how the legendary Kraken attacks three brave Kerbonauts and their ship. The original Kraken bug was caused by floating point errors in deep space, and caused many problems for players until it was finally fixed in version 0.17. Do you ever blame something on the Kraken?

"Do you ever blame something on the Kraken?"

Is that a rhetoric question? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Since i've started playing this fine game, i have seen so many strange, weird, inexplainable and downright freaky things happen i started to make offerings to His Tentacleness before any major launch. I tried carrots, cheap watches and tossing Menthos into a Pepsi bottle. Nothing worked so far, but i'm hopeful.

> 
> Do you ever blame something on the Kraken?

Cool artwork, and yeah I've blamed stuff on the kraken.
Once I attempted to make Jeb stop smiling by feeding him to the Kraken, it didn't work ![;.;](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cry.gif)

There is only one Kraken, and Danny2462 is his prophet.

 ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Casual blasphemy aside, my internal monologue has adopted the common practice of blaming any Exceptional behavior on the kraken... so I blame it for plenty, still. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Cool image, though! I like that Jeb is still grinning. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-03T21:52:43Z" title="04/03/2015 09:52  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 3, 2015</time> by toadicus**
The Kraken. The almighty god of the heavens. With Danny, Nexter and Whackjob being his worshippers, and Squad his nemesis.

Whoa, my art was featured!? That's awesome ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) Thanks, Squad!

I'm pretty sure 'Kraken' is synonymous to any weird destructive glitches nowadays, so the Kraken is probably blamed for a lot of things. I had this weird quicksaving bug a month or two ago that I blamed on the Kraken.

It seemed like all of my ships yesterday were getting the Kraken right after launch into insertion orbit.

Then it turned out I forgot I had FAR flight assistance options still on and were causing all sortsa weird oscillations. DOH! ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

The issue here is that it's called "kracken" no amount of tom-foolery, hubub, or shinanigans will do any good until the monstrosity is called (beckoned or summoned) by it's rightful name...Cthulhu (sometimes flying spaghetti monster works too)

There are a lot of Krakens... but the original prevails. The Original Kraken now goes by a different identity... the Cthulhu.

And maybe... he's a good guy.

(DUNDUNDUN)

EDIT: I think the fan-art is wrong. Not that I hate the guy who made it, I just kinda think that's not what happens in a KSP save.

> 
> Do you ever blame something on the Kraken?

When I first started playing I decided to land a mk1 command pod on Kerbin's north pole upside-down. The landing went smoothly and I told Jeb to get out and take a walk. The ship starts shaking then explodes sending Jeb on a Kerbol escape trajectory at ~0.9C. The Kraken may have got the ship, but Jeb survived passing Duna's orbit before I deleted that save.
The original Kraken may have been fixed in 0.17, but I'm sorry to say the devs didn't get to it in time. It has apparently left little Kraken Jr's. all over the Kerbolar system...
